content.description: One of the best hand cracks the area has to offer. Lieback in a perfect corner to a large edge right before topping out.
content.protection: Protects well with a couple #1 Camalots or a few finger sized pieces. A top rope anchor can also be set up using multiple earth anchors and a #3 or #4 Camalot. Bring a couple long cordelettes or a static line to assist with properly equalizing everything.
content.location: Located on the largest cliffs nearest to the highway, and directly behind the two prominent boulders furthest south. Scramble around the east side of the outcrop to set up an anchor if top roping.

content.description: Sit start with a thirty five move crux

This sandstone outcrop can be seen on the North side of Interstate 94 just past Medora, ND. It features relatively lower quality sandstone cliffs and boulders with splitter cracks. Although fragile face features will most likely break off, the cracks themselves are strong and can be protected with gear. Most of the 20-30ft blocks can also be top roped by use of earth anchors or climbed as highball boulders. Always inspect suspect flakes and chockstones prior to climbing, as large features have been known to fall off.
